meanings.definition: To remove or take out (something) from a place
meanings.sent1: She was extracting the toy from the box.
meanings.sent2: The dentist was extracting the tooth carefully.
meanings.sent3: He tried extracting the joke from the situation.
meanings.sent4: The detective was extracting the truth from the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The chef was extracting the flavors from the spices.

meanings.definition: To obtain (a substance or resource) from a material
meanings.sent1: The miners were extracting coal from the mine.
meanings.sent2: They were extracting oil from the ground.
meanings.sent3: She was extracting laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist was extracting beauty from the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The bees were extracting nectar from the flowers.

meanings.definition: To derive or obtain (information) from a source
meanings.sent1: The researcher was extracting data from the survey.
meanings.sent2: They were extracting knowledge from the books.
meanings.sent3: He was extracting humor from the situation.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was extracting truth from the interviews.
meanings.sent5: The students were extracting wisdom from the teacher.
